hints.content: The parentheses tell us which two numbers to multiply first.

Ashanti solved the equation by multiplying $(\purpleE{5}\times\maroonE{4})$ first, and then multiplying by $\redE{2}$.

$\begin{align}
\redE{2} \times \purpleE{5} \times \maroonE{4} &= \redE{2}\times(\purpleE{5}\times\maroonE{4})\\\\
&=\redE{2}\times\goldE{20}\\\\ 
&=40
\end{align}$

In the new equation below, we want to multiply $(\redE{2}\times\purpleE{5})$ first, and then multiply by $\maroonE{4}$.

$\begin{align}
\redE{2} \times \purpleE{5} \times \maroonE{4} &=(\redE{2}\times\purpleE{5}) \times\maroonE{4}\\\\
&=\blueE{10}\times\maroonE{4}\\\\
&=40
\end{align}$

question.content:
Ashanti solved $\redE{2} \times \purpleE{5} \times\maroonE{4}$ using the equations below.

$\begin{align}
\redE{2} \times \purpleE{5} \times \maroonE{4} &=\redE{2}\times(\purpleE{5} \times\maroonE{4})\\\\ 
&=\redE{2}\times 20 \\\\\  
&=40
\end{align}$

**Use the equations below to solve $\redE{2} \times \purpleE{5} \times \maroonE{4}$ in a different way.**

||
-:|:-
$\redE{2} \times \purpleE{5} \times \maroonE{4}$ | $=(\redE{2}\times {}$ [[☃ numeric-input 1]]$)\times\maroonE{4}$  |
|$=$ [[☃ numeric-input 2]] ${}\times\maroonE{4}$|
|$= 40$|
